sources.title: The Squall (1929) MYRNA LOYüçï LORETTA YOUNGüçï ZAZU PITTS
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: Myrna Loy, Loretta Young, Zasu Pitts
Director: Alexander Korda
üçïMyrna Loy Before The Thin Manüçï
Before she became Hollywood‚Äôs beloved Nora Charles, Myrna Loy turned heads in one of her earliest breakout roles‚Äîplaying a seductive Romani gypsy who stirs chaos and desire in a peaceful Hungarian household. Released by First National Pictures and directed by Alexander Korda, this pre-Code drama blends domestic tension with exoticism, all anchored by Loy‚Äôs magnetic screen presence.

Set on a rural estate, the story unfolds when a violent storm brings a mysterious young woman‚Äîplayed by Loy‚Äîinto the home of a respectable family. Her arrival disrupts the quiet order of their lives, igniting jealousy, forbidden attraction, and emotional unrest. The supporting cast includes Loretta Young, Zasu Pitts, and Alice Joyce, but it's Loy‚Äôs bold, early performance that truly commands the screen.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

Based on the stage play by Jean Bart, the film capitalized on pre-Code sensibilities, exploring themes of temptation and class tension. With strong visual style and a daring lead performance, it captures a moment in cinema when boundaries were being tested‚Äîand stars like Myrna Loy were just beginning to shine.

#TheSquall #MyrnaLoy #LorettaYoung #ZasuPitts #AliceJoyce #AlexanderKorda #FirstNationalPictures #1929Movies #PreCodeHollywood #GoldenAgeOfHollywood #ClassicCinema #pizzaflix

metadata.Plot: In Hungary, a prosperous and happy family of farmers take in a Gypsy girl, Nubi, when she runs away from her "cruel" master. Her fickle and seductive nature soon causes discord among the men of the household.
metadata.Writer: Jean Bart, Bradley King, Paul Perez
metadata.Actors: Alice Joyce, Richard Tucker, Myrna Loy
